homestays.name: Himalayan Eco Lodge
homestays.quick_version: Traditional Himachali homestay with apple orchards, solar powered, organic farm.
homestays.description: Traditional Himachali homestay surrounded by apple orchards and pine forests with stunning valley views. Family-run establishment offering organic farm-to-table meals, yoga sessions, and guided nature walks. Solar-powered and eco-friendly with commitment to sustainable tourism.
homestays.best_season: March to June, September to November
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Book well in advance for peak season (May-June). Winters are very cold with limited heating - pack warm clothes.

homestays.name: Kerala Backwater Heritage Home
homestays.quick_version: Traditional Kerala home on backwaters, authentic cuisine, canoe rides.
homestays.description: 150-year-old traditional Kerala Tharavad (ancestral home) on serene backwaters. Experience authentic Kerala lifestyle with home-cooked Sadya, canoe rides, fishing, and Kathakali performances. Family shares cultural traditions and stories.
homestays.best_season: October to March (avoid monsoon heavy rains)
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Mosquitoes common near backwaters - bring repellent. Homestay provides nets but personal protection useful.

homestays.name: Rajasthani Desert Camp Homestay
homestays.quick_version: Traditional desert camp with camel safaris, folk music, stargazing.
homestays.description: Authentic desert experience in Thar Desert with traditional Rajasthani hospitality. Camel safaris, sand dunes, folk music and dance performances under stars. Family has been desert guides for generations.
unique_experiences: Camel safari to sam sand dunes
homestays.best_season: October to March (avoid extreme summer heat)
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Desert nights are cold even when days are hot. Bring warm layers for evening. Summer (April-June) unbearably hot - avoid.

homestays.name: Ladakh Traditional Homestay
homestays.quick_version: High-altitude Ladakhi home, traditional architecture, Buddhist culture immersion.
homestays.description: Traditional Ladakhi home with thick walls and low ceilings for high-altitude insulation. Experience Buddhist culture, prayer flags, home-cooked Ladakhi meals, and warm hospitality. Family shares local knowledge for treks and cultural sites.
unique_experiences: Local festival participation if timing matches
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Acclimatize 2-3 days in Leh before physical activities. Altitude sickness real risk. Water scarce - conserve mindfully. Winter months homestays mostly closed.

homestays.name: Sikkim Organic Farm Homestay
homestays.quick_version: Organic cardamom farm homestay, Kanchenjunga views, farm experiences.
homestays.description: Award-winning organic cardamom and flower farm with breathtaking Kanchenjunga views. Sikkim is India's first fully organic state. Experience farm life, traditional Nepali-Sikkimese culture, and pristine nature. Family passionate about sustainable agriculture.
homestays.best_season: March to May (spring flowers), September to November (clear mountain views)
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Sikkim requires permits even for Indians in some areas. Homestay can arrange. Monsoon (June-August) has leeches - bring repellent.

homestays.name: Goa Portuguese Heritage Home
homestays.quick_version: 200-year-old Portuguese villa, near quiet beaches, authentic Goan hospitality.
homestays.description: Beautifully preserved 200-year-old Portuguese villa with original azulejo tiles, antique furniture, and lush gardens. Near quiet South Goa beaches. Experience authentic Goan Catholic culture, home-cooked Goan cuisine, and laid-back lifestyle. Family has stories spanning generations.
homestays.best_season: November to February (peak season), October and March (shoulder - pleasant)
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Peak season (Dec-Jan) books months ahead. Monsoon (June-Sept) has charm but many beaches unsafe for swimming. South Goa quieter than North - choose based on preference.

homestays.name: Tamil Nadu Temple Town Homestay
homestays.quick_version: Traditional Brahmin home near temples, authentic South Indian vegetarian cuisine.
homestays.description: Traditional Brahmin home in heart of temple town. Experience authentic South Indian lifestyle, vegetarian culinary traditions, classical music, and temple culture. Host family knowledgeable about temple history and can guide temple visits. Walking distance to multiple ancient temples.
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Strictly vegetarian and no alcohol - respect house rules. Temple visits require modest dress. Noon to 4 PM temple closure means plan morning or evening visits.

homestays.name: Meghalaya Village Homestay
homestays.quick_version: Asia's cleanest village homestay, living root bridges, Khasi culture.
homestays.description: Homestay in Mawlynnong - Asia's cleanest village. Experience Khasi tribal culture, living root bridges, pristine forests, and community-led cleanliness. Village has won multiple awards for cleanliness and sustainable tourism. Basic but authentic experience.
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Basic facilities - no luxury amenities. Bring torch and be prepared for simple living. Monsoon spectacular but very wet. Living root bridge trek requires fitness.

homestays.name: Uttarakhand Riverside Cottage
homestays.quick_version: Ganga riverside cottage with yoga sessions, meditation, spiritual atmosphere.
homestays.description: Peaceful cottage on Ganga riverbank surrounded by forests. Daily yoga and meditation sessions, vegetarian sattvic meals, and spiritual atmosphere. Away from Rishikesh's commercial area. Host is certified yoga teacher. Perfect for spiritual retreat or detox.
homestays.best_season: September to November, February to April (International Yoga Festival in March)
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Strictly vegetarian, no alcohol, no smoking. Respectful atmosphere maintained. Book advance for Yoga Festival time. Monsoon river can be rough.

homestays.name: Coorg Coffee Plantation Homestay
homestays.quick_version: Coffee and spice plantation homestay, estate walks, Kodava culture.
homestays.description: Working coffee and spice plantation in misty Coorg hills. Experience coffee cultivation from bean to cup, estate walks through cardamom and pepper plantations, wildlife spotting, and authentic Kodava (Coorg) hospitality. Family has been planters for generations.
homestays.avoid_common_mistake: Coffee harvest season (Nov-Jan) most interesting but book well advance. Monsoon (June-Sept) has leeches - bring repellent. Coorg food includes pork - inform if dietary restrictions.
